objectives.name: Primary Objective (Part A)
objectives.text: To determine whether BIVV009 administration results in a ≥2 g/dL increase in hemoglobin (Hgb) levels or increases Hgb to ≥12 g/dL and obviates the need for blood transfusion during treatment in patients with primary CAgD who have a recent history of blood transfusion.

objectives.name: Secondary Efficacy Objective (Part A)
objectives.text: To assess the effect of BIVV009 on clinical events and laboratory parameters related to hemolysis and anemia in patients with primary CAgD

objectives.name: Secondary Quality of Life Objective (Part A)
objectives.text: To assess the effect of BIVV009 on quality of life (QOL) in patients with primary CAgD

objectives.name: Secondary Safety Objective (Part A)
objectives.text: To evaluate the overall safety and tolerability of BIVV009 in patients with primary CAgD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective (Part A) - Complications
objectives.text: To assess the effect of BIVV009 on specific complications of CAgD (acrocyanosis, Raynaud’s syndrome, hemoglobinuria, and thromboembolism)

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective (Part A) - Biomarkers
objectives.text: To evaluate the effect of BIVV009 on certain disease-related biomarkers in patients with primary CAgD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective (Part A) - Pharmacokinetics
objectives.text: To evaluate the pharmacokinetics of BIVV009

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective (Part A) - Immunogenicity
objectives.text: To evaluate the immunogenicity of BIVV009

objectives.name: Primary Objective (Part B)
objectives.text: The primary objective of Part B is to evaluate the long-term safety and tolerability of BIVV009 in patients with primary CAgD.

objectives.name: Secondary Objective (Part B)
objectives.text: The secondary objective of Part B is to investigate the durability of response during long-term treatment with BIVV009 in patients with primary CAgD.

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective (Part B) - Home Infusion
objectives.text: To describe the safety and patient satisfaction with the convenience of home infusions with BIVV009 in a subset of patients

endpoints.name: Primary Efficacy Endpoint (Part A)
endpoints.text: The primary efficacy endpoint is the responder rate as defined in Table 2 (≥2 g/dL increase in Hgb or Hgb ≥12 g/dL and no transfusion from Week 5 to 26).

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Endpoint - Bilirubin
endpoints.text: Mean change from baseline in bilirubin (excluding patients with Gilbert’s Syndrome) at the treatment assessment endpoint

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Endpoint - FACIT-Fatigue
endpoints.text: Mean change from baseline in QOL, as assessed by the change in Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT)-Fatigue scale scores at the treatment assessment endpoint

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Endpoint - LDH
endpoints.text: Mean change from baseline in lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) at the treatment assessment endpoint

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Endpoint - Transfusions
endpoints.text: Number of transfusions and number of units after the first 5 weeks of study drug administration

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Endpoint - Hgb
endpoints.text: Mean change from baseline in Hgb at the treatment assessment endpoint

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - Time to Transfusion
endpoints.text: Time to first transfusion after the first 5 weeks of study drug administration

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - EQ-5D-5L
endpoints.text: Mean change from baseline in QOL, as assessed by the change in the five level EuroQol - five dimensions questionnaire (EQ-5D-5L) scores at the treatment assessment endpoint

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - SF-12
endpoints.text: Mean change from baseline in QOL, as assessed by the change in the 12-Item Short Form Survey (SF-12®) at the end of treatment assessment endpoint

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - Symptomatic Anemia
endpoints.text: Incidence of solicited symptomatic anemia at EOT

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - Hgb Threshold
endpoints.text: Proportion of patients with Hgb level of ≥12 g/dL at the treatment assessment endpoint

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - Thromboembolism
endpoints.text: Incidence of thromboembolic events after the first 5 weeks of study drug administration

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - Normalization Time
endpoints.text: Median time to normalization of bilirubin, LDH, and haptoglobin

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - Haptoglobin Normalization
endpoints.text: Proportion of patients normalizing haptoglobin at the treatment assessment endpoint

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - Bilirubin Normalization
endpoints.text: Proportion of patients normalizing bilirubin at the treatment assessment endpoint

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - LDH Normalization
endpoints.text: Proportion of patients normalizing LDH at the treatment assessment endpoint

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - PGIC
endpoints.text: Patient’s Global Impression of Change (PGIC) to assess patient’s perception of changes in CAgD disease burden at EOT

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - PGIS
endpoints.text: Patient’s Global Impression of [Fatigue] Severity (PGIS) to assess patient’s perception of changes in fatigue at EOT

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - Circulatory Symptoms
endpoints.text: Incidence of disabling circulatory symptoms at EOT

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - Resource Utilization
endpoints.text: Total healthcare resource utilization at EOT

endpoints.name: Safety Outcome Measures - General
endpoints.text: Adverse events (AEs), serious AEs, clinical laboratory evaluations, SLE panel, vital sign measurements, electrocardiograms (ECGs), physical examination findings, and serum disease-related biomarkers.

endpoints.name: Safety Outcome Measures - Hemolytic Breakthrough
endpoints.text: Hemolytic breakthrough (rapid fall in Hgb ≥2 g/dL associated with an increase in LDH/bilirubin and/or decrease in haptoglobin since the last scheduled visit) through the EOT at Week 26

endpoints.name: Safety Outcome Measures - Infections
endpoints.text: Infections of ≥ Grade 3 severity (ie, requiring IV antibiotics)

endpoints.name: Safety Outcome Measures - Home Infusion
endpoints.text: For patients with home infusions, safety assessments will additionally include AEs with onset within 24 hours of the infusion

endpoints.name: Pharmacokinetic Endpoint - Concentration
endpoints.text: Plasma concentrations of BIVV009

endpoints.name: Pharmacokinetic Endpoint - Parameters
endpoints.text: PK parameters. Appropriate exposure parameters (Cmax, AUC) will be derived using a population approach.

endpoints.name: Pharmacodynamic Primary Outcome Measure
endpoints.text: Wieslab-CP

endpoints.name: Exploratory Complement System Measures
endpoints.text: CH50, Total C4, C1q, C1s

endpoints.name: Immunogenicity Outcome Measures
endpoints.text: Pre-existing ADA and treatment-emergent ADA

endpoints.name: Home Infusion Satisfaction
endpoints.text: Satisfaction with home infusion after first home infusion and after four home infusion will be assessed in patients with home infusion

estimands.name: Primary Efficacy Estimand (Part A)
estimands.populationSummary: Adult patients with primary cold agglutinin disease (CAgD) who have a recent history of blood transfusion (Full Analysis Set) Summary measure: Proportion of responders with 95% exact Clopper-Pearson confidence interval.

intercurrentEvents.name: Withdrawal from study
intercurrentEvents.text: Any patient withdrawing from the study after Week 5 and prior to the Week 23 visit

intercurrentEvents.name: Use of prohibited CAgD therapies
intercurrentEvents.text: Patients requiring other treatment for their CAgD in Part A

intercurrentEvents.name: Blood transfusion
intercurrentEvents.text: Receipt of blood transfusion from Week 5 through Week 26

estimands.treatment: BIVV009 (6.5 g or 7.5 g based on weight) IV infusion on Day 0, Day 7, and every 14 days thereafter
estimands.analysisPopulation: Adult patients with primary cold agglutinin disease (CAgD) who have a recent history of blood transfusion (Full Analysis Set)
estimands.variableOfInterest: Responder rate (≥2 g/dL increase in Hgb or Hgb ≥12 g/dL and no blood transfusion from Week 5 through Week 26)
estimands.summaryMeasure: Proportion of responders with 95% exact Clopper-Pearson confidence interval

estimands.name: Secondary Efficacy Estimand - Hemoglobin Change
estimands.populationSummary: Adult patients with primary cold agglutinin disease (CAgD) who have a recent history of blood transfusion (Full Analysis Set) Summary measure: Mean change from baseline analyzed using a one-sample t-test.

intercurrentEvents.name: Treatment discontinuation
intercurrentEvents.text: Discontinuation of study drug prior to Week 26

estimands.treatment: BIVV009 (6.5 g or 7.5 g based on weight) IV infusion
estimands.analysisPopulation: Adult patients with primary cold agglutinin disease (CAgD) who have a recent history of blood transfusion (Full Analysis Set)
estimands.variableOfInterest: Mean change from baseline in Hgb at the treatment assessment endpoint (Weeks 23, 25, and 26)
estimands.summaryMeasure: Mean change from baseline analyzed using a one-sample t-test
